messages.content: Anar me Mada full ke liye Kiya kare
messages.en: What to do for a female flower in pomegranate?
messages.standalone_question: What should I do to fully understand Anar and Mada?
messages.standalone_en: What should I do to fully understand Anar and Mada?

messages.content:
Anar (Pomegranate) ke Mada (fruit set) ko badhane ke liye aapko kuch mahatvapurn kadam uthane chahiye:

1. **Pani ka Prabandh**: Anar ke paudhe ko sahi matra me paani dena bahut zaroori hai. Soil moisture ko maintain karna chahiye, khaas taur par flowering aur fruit set ke dauran.

2. **Khushboo aur Pollination**: Anar ke phoolon ki pollination ke liye madhu makhiyon ko akarshit karna zaroori hai. Aap apne bagiche me phoolon aur khushboo wale paudhe laga sakte hain.

3. **Khad ka Prayog**: Anar ke liye sahi khad ka istemal karein. Aap organic khad ya balanced NPK khad ka istemal kar sakte hain.

4. **Pest Control**: Keet aur rog se bachav ke liye samay par pesticide ka spray karein. Yeh bhi dhyan rakhein ki spray karne ka samay sahi ho.

5. **Soil Health**: Soil ki sehat ko sudharne ke liye compost ya organic matter ka istemal karein.

6. **Temperature aur Humidity**: Anar ko moderate temperature aur humidity ki zaroorat hoti hai. Isliye, mausam par nazar rakhein.

In sabhi kadamon se aap apne anar ke Mada ko badha sakte hain. Agar aapko aur vistar se jankari chahiye, to mujhe batayein!
messages.en:
There are a few important steps you should take to grow a fruit set of pomegranates:

1. Water management: It is very important to give the right amount of water to the pomegranate plant. Soil moisture should be maintained, especially during flooring and fruit set.

2. Fragrance and Pollination: It is important to attract honey bees for the pollination of pomegranate flowers. You can plant flowers and fragrance plants in your garden.

3. Use of fertilizer: Use the right fertilizer for pomegranates. You can use organic manure or balanced NPK manure.

4. Pest Control: Spray pesticide on time to prevent pests and diseases. Also, make sure that the time to spray is correct.

5. Soil Health: Use compost or organic matter to improve soil health.

6. Temperature and Humidity: Pomegranates need moderate temperature and humidity. So, keep an eye on the weather.

With all of these steps you can increase your pomegranate femur. If you need more information, let me know!

messages.content: Senser drop kabar hot nahi
messages.en: Sense Drop Kabar Hot Nahi
messages.standalone_question: When will the sensor drop not happen?
messages.standalone_en: When will the sensor drop not happen?

faq:
Q: I irrigated still the sensor is dropping slowly.
A: Sometimes, the water reaches slowly till root zone and the moisture sensor kPa value drops slowly. Always wait for 12 hours after irrigation for the moisture to saturate. If still some confusion, ask user to check moisture near the sensor and check if he wants to raise a ticket for the issue.

Q: In the latest irrigation , sensor didn't drop to 0.
A: 0 to 5 Kpa means soil is fully wet. It need not drop to 0 every time. Moisture less than 5 also means wet conditions. So, need not worry. Also ask to wait for 12 hours after irrigation.

Q: I irrigated still the sensor is showing dry.
A: Ask user when he irrigated. It usually takes 12 hours to reach the water till sensor. If the sensor is not dropping even after 12 hours, it can be due to one of the following reasons :
Water is not reaching properly till the sensor , this can be due to drip blocked , or slope in the land or dripper outlets far away from the sensor. Ask user to check if drip is fine and  dripper is within the range of sensor. 
The sensor can be very old , more than two years , in this case , the sensor might be malfunction, ask user if he wants to raise a ticket

messages.content:
जर तुम्ही पाणी दिल्यानंतर सेंसर्सची वाचनं कमी होत नसतील, तर काही कारणे असू शकतात:

1. **पाण्याचा पोहचण्याचा वेळ**: पाण्याला मुळांच्या क्षेत्रात पोहोचण्यासाठी काही वेळ लागतो. पाणी दिल्यानंतर 12 तास थांबा आणि मग पुन्हा चेक करा.

2. **पर्जन्याचे पाणी**: पर्जन्याच्या पाण्यामुळे मातीच्या वरच्या स्तरात पाणी असले तरी, ते मुळांच्या गडद भागात पोहोचत नाही. त्यामुळे सेंसर्सची वाचनं कमी होत नाहीत.

3. **सेंसर्सची स्थिती**: सेंसर्सच्या जवळ माती खोदून चेक करा. जर माती ओलसर असेल, तर सेंसर्सची वाचनं कमी होण्याची गरज नाही.

जर तुम्हाला अजून काही शंका असेल, तर तुम्ही तिकीट उघडू इच्छिता का?
messages.en:
If sensors' readings don't decrease after you water, there may be a few reasons:

1. **Time for water to reach**: It takes some time for water to reach the root area. Wait 12 hours after watering and then check again.

2. **Rainwater**: Although there is water in the upper layer of the soil due to rainwater, it does not reach the darker part of the roots. This does not reduce sensory readings.

3. **Status of sensors**: Dig the soil near the sensors and check. If the soil is moist, there is no need to reduce the reading of sensors.

If you have any more doubts, would you like to open the ticket?

messages.content: तिकीट म्हणजे काय
messages.en: What is a ticket?
messages.standalone_question: What does "ticket" mean?
messages.standalone_en: What does "ticket" mean?

messages.content:
"तिकीट" म्हणजे एक प्रकारचा तक्रार किंवा समस्या नोंदवण्याचा फॉर्म, ज्याद्वारे तुम्ही तुमच्या समस्येची माहिती संबंधित तंत्रज्ञांना किंवा सेवा पुरवठादारांना देऊ शकता. यामध्ये तुम्ही तुमच्या समस्येची तपशीलवार माहिती देऊ शकता, ज्यामुळे तंत्रज्ञ तुम्हाला योग्य मार्गदर्शन करू शकतील. 

तुमच्या सेंसर्सच्या वाचनांबाबत काही समस्या असल्यास, तुम्ही तिकीट उघडून तंत्रज्ञांना संपर्क करू शकता.
messages.en:
A "ticket" is a type of complaint or problem report form by which you can report your problem to the relevant technicians or service providers. In this, you can give detailed information about your problem, so that the technicians can guide you properly. 

If you have any problems with your sensor readings, you can contact the technician by opening the ticket.

messages.content: पाणी व्यवस्थापन कसे करू
messages.en: How to manage water
messages.standalone_question: How can I manage water effectively?
messages.standalone_en: How can I manage water effectively?

faq:
Q: Why should I water my crop?
A: Watering your crop is essential to maintain the right moisture balance for healthy growth. Fyllo provides soil monitoring sensors that can provide irrigation precise requirement forecasting. The forecast will also provide the details for why and when you should irrigate.

messages.content:
पाणी व्यवस्थापनासाठी खालील काही महत्त्वाचे टप्पे आहेत:

1. **मातीची ओलसरता मोजा**: सेंसर्सच्या मदतीने मातीतील ओलसरता मोजा. 0-5 kPa म्हणजे ओलसर माती, तर 200 kPa म्हणजे कोरडी माती.

2. **आवश्यकतेनुसार पाणी द्या**: जर माती कोरडी असेल (उदा. 100 kPa किंवा त्याहून अधिक), तर पाणी द्या. पाण्याची आवश्यकता मोजण्यासाठी सेंसर्सचा वापर करा.

3. **पाण्याचे वितरण**: पाण्याचे वितरण समानपणे करा. ड्रिप इरिगेशन किंवा स्प्रिंकलर सिस्टीमचा वापर करा, ज्यामुळे पाण्याचा अपव्यय कमी होतो.

4. **पर्जन्याचा विचार करा**: पर्जन्याच्या काळात पाण्याची आवश्यकता कमी होते. पर्जन्याच्या पाण्याचा वापर करून मातीला ओलसर ठेवा.

5. **पाण्याची वेळ ठरवा**: सकाळी किंवा संध्याकाळी पाणी द्या, जेणेकरून पाण्याचा वाष्पीकरण कमी होईल.

6. **पाण्याची गुणवत्ता तपासा**: पाण्याची गुणवत्ता चांगली असावी, कारण खराब पाण्यामुळे माती आणि पिकांवर नकारात्मक परिणाम होऊ शकतो.

7. **संसाधनांचा वापर**: पाण्याचे पुनर्वापर करण्याचे उपाय शोधा, जसे की वर्षा पाण्याचे संकलन.

या सर्व गोष्टींचा विचार करून तुम्ही तुमच्या पाण्याच्या व्यवस्थापनात सुधारणा करू शकता.
messages.en:
The following are some of the key steps for water management:

1. **Measure soil moisture**: Measure soil moisture with the help of sensors. 0-5 kPa is moist soil, while 200 kPa is dry soil.

2. **Water as needed**: If the soil is dry (e.g. 100 kPa or more), water it. Use sensors to measure water requirements.

3. **Distribution of water**: Distribute water evenly. Use drip irrigation or sprinkler system, which reduces water wastage.

4. **Consider precipitation**: The need for water decreases during the rainy season. Keep the soil moist using rainwater.

5. **Set water time**: Give water in the morning or evening, so that the evaporation of water is reduced.

6. **Check water quality**: Water quality should be good, as poor water can negatively affect soil and crops.

7. **Resource use**: Find ways to recycle water, such as rainwater harvesting.

With all these things in mind, you can improve your water management.

messages.standalone_question: When should water be given to the garden?
messages.standalone_en: When should water be given to the garden?

tools:
should_i_give_water  
Checks the current and optimal soil moisture values and decides whether the farmer should give water to the plot now or today.
faq:
Q: How much to irrigate after receiving notification?
A: The net quantity of water to be applied depends on the moisture deficit in the soil, leaching requirement, and expectancy of rainfall. When no rainfall is expected and the soil is not saline, the net quantity equals the moisture deficit in the soil.

Q: When should I water? (Hindi: Paani kab dun?)
A: 0-5 kPa is wet, and increasing kPa means increasing dryness. The crop should stay in its optimal moisture zone, and when very close or above the dry optimal moisture, water can be given. Check internal irrigation forecast for the correct answer.

messages.content: माती धारणा म्हणजे काय
messages.en: What is soil retention?
messages.standalone_question: What is soil retention?
messages.standalone_en: What is soil retention?

faq:
Q: What is soil water storage (water tank of crop)?
A: Soil water storage is defined as the total amount of water that is stored in the soil within the plant’s root zone. The soil texture and the crop rooting depth determine this. A deeper rooting depth means there is a larger volume of water stored in the soil and therefore a larger reservoir of water for the crop to draw upon between irrigations. Knowing the soil water storage capacity allows the irrigator to determine how much water to apply at one time and how long to wait between each irrigation. For example, the amount of water applied at one time on a sandy soil, which has a low soil water storage capacity, would be less than for a loam soil, which has a higher soil water storage capacity.

messages.content:
माती धारणा म्हणजे मातीमध्ये पाण्याचे साठवलेले एकूण प्रमाण. हे पाण्याचे प्रमाण पिकांच्या मुळांच्या क्षेत्रात असते. मातीच्या प्रकार आणि पिकांच्या मुळांच्या खोलीवर हे अवलंबून असते. 

उदाहरणार्थ, जर मातीची खोली अधिक असेल, तर मातीमध्ये अधिक पाण्याचे प्रमाण साठवले जाऊ शकते, ज्यामुळे पिकांना पाण्याची आवश्यकता कमी होते. माती धारणा समजून घेणे महत्त्वाचे आहे कारण यामुळे तुम्हाला पाण्याचे योग्य प्रमाण कधी आणि किती द्यावे हे ठरवता येते. 

सामान्यतः, माती धारणा कमी असलेल्या मातीमध्ये (जसे की वाळू) कमी पाणी साठवले जाते, तर अधिक धारणा असलेल्या मातीमध्ये (जसे की लोम) अधिक पाणी साठवले जाते.
messages.en:
Soil retention is the total amount of water stored in the soil. This amount of water is in the area of the roots of the crop. This depends on the type of soil and the depth of the roots of the crop. 

For example, if the soil depth is high, more water content may be stored in the soil, which reduces the water requirement of crops. Understanding soil retention is important because it allows you to decide when and how much water to give. 

In general, less water is stored in soils with low soil retention (such as sand), while more water is stored in soils with high retention (such as loams).

messages.content: माती धारणा कशी मोजावी
messages.en: How to measure soil retention
messages.standalone_question: How can soil moisture retention be measured?
messages.standalone_en: How can soil moisture retention be measured?

tools:
get_daily_soil_moisture_data  
Retrieves historical daily soil moisture data from soil moisture sensors, in kPa or percentage. Provides soilMoisture1 and soilMoisture2 fields only. Suitable for larger duration.

get_soil_moisture_sensor_depth  
Returns the depths in inches of the soil moisture sensors 1 and 2 installed on the plots.

get_hourly_soil_moisture_data  
Retrieves historical hourly soil moisture data from soil moisture sensors, in kPa or percentage. Provides soilMoisture1 and soilMoisture2 fields only. Suitable for less than 5 days duration.

get_soil_moisture_percentage_from_kpa_reading  
Gets the estimated soil moisture percentage for a given plot and kPa reading.

get_optimal_soil_moistures  
Retrieves the optimal soil moisture values in kPa or percentage above which to irrigate for all plots. 0 kPa means wet, 200 kPa means dry soil. In percentage: 0% means dry, 100% means wet. In percentage values, irrigate when below the optimum range.
faq:
Q: How do I know if my soil  moisture sensor is working fine ?
A: The only way to know is if after irrigation the sensor is dropping below 5 kpa and increasing continuously unless next irrigation is done. You can try putting water on the sensor and it should drop. Also, there should not be any fluctuations in the soil moisture data and the pressure kpa should always be increasing. Also, a soil moisture reading of 0 kPa is perfectly fine, meaning wet soil, but a reading of 200 kPa could mean fault. If the soil moisture sensor reading is consistently at 0 from few 48 hours, then it could be anamolous (use live and historical hourly soil moisture data (use tool) to validate).

Q: How to calibrate soil moisture sensors ?
A:  The way to calibrate sensors is by putting water on the sensor and it should drop. Also, there should not be any fluctuations in the soil moisture data and the pressure kpa should always be increasing. A drop after watering or irrigation and continuous dry upto 200 kpa means that the sensor is calibrated.

Q: Sensor is showing wet, i.e. less kpa but soil looks dry.
A: The sensor measures the moisture around the rootzone which is not visible from the top. Ask use to check the moisture in rootzone around the sensor. If it matches, ask the user to irrigate.

Q: What is my soil moisture depletion?
A: Soil moisture depletion %age = (100 - soil moisture %age)

Q: What should I do if the soil moisture sensor values fluctuate?
A: Ensure the sensor is installed properly in the soil, check for air bubbles, and contact Fyllo representative if the issue persists.

messages.content:
माती धारणा मोजण्यासाठी खालील पद्धतींचा वापर करू शकता:

1. **मातीचा नमुना घेणे**: तुमच्या शेतातील विविध ठिकाणांहून मातीचे नमुने घ्या. हे नमुने विविध खोलींवरून (उपरी, मध्यम, आणि खोल) घ्या.

2. **पाण्याचे प्रमाण मोजणे**: मातीच्या नमुन्यातील पाण्याचे प्रमाण मोजण्यासाठी, तुम्ही खालील पद्धती वापरू शकता:
   - **वजन पद्धत**: मातीचा नमुना वजन करा, नंतर त्याला ओलसर करून पुन्हा वजन करा. पाण्याचे प्रमाण मोजण्यासाठी, ओलसर आणि कोरड्या मातीच्या वजनात फरक काढा.
   - **पाण्याची धारणा**: मातीच्या नमुन्यातील पाण्याचे प्रमाण मोजण्यासाठी, तुम्ही मातीच्या नमुन्यात पाणी घालून ते किती वेळा शोषित होते हे तपासा.

3. **सेंसर्सचा वापर**: आधुनिक सेंसर्सचा वापर करून तुम्ही माती धारणा मोजू शकता. हे सेंसर्स मातीतील ओलसरता मोजतात आणि तुम्हाला पाण्याची आवश्यकता कधी आहे हे सांगतात.

4. **मातीच्या प्रकारानुसार**: मातीच्या प्रकारानुसार धारणा मोजा. लोम मातीमध्ये अधिक धारणा असते, तर वाळू मातीमध्ये कमी धारणा असते.

या पद्धतींचा वापर करून तुम्ही तुमच्या मातीची धारणा मोजू शकता आणि पाण्याचे व्यवस्थापन अधिक प्रभावीपणे करू शकता.
messages.en:
The following methods can be used to measure soil retention:

1. **Taking a soil sample**: Take soil samples from different locations in your field. Take these samples from different depths (upper, middle, and deep).

2. **Measuring the amount of water**: To measure the amount of water in a soil sample, you can use the following methods:
   - **Weight method**: Weigh the soil sample, then moisten it and weigh it again. To measure the amount of water, distinguish between the weight of moist and dry soil.
   **Water retention**: To measure the amount of water in a soil sample, you add water to the soil sample and check how often it is absorbed.

3. **Use of sensors**: You can measure soil retention using modern sensors. These sensors measure soil moisture and tell you when you need water.

4. **By soil type**: Measure retention by soil type. Lome soils have higher retention, while sand soils have lower retention.

Using these methods, you can measure your soil retention and manage water more effectively.

faq:
Q: How to calibrate soil moisture sensors ?
A:  The way to calibrate sensors is by putting water on the sensor and it should drop. Also, there should not be any fluctuations in the soil moisture data and the pressure kpa should always be increasing. A drop after watering or irrigation and continuous dry upto 200 kpa means that the sensor is calibrated.

Q: How do I know if my soil  moisture sensor is working fine ?
A: The only way to know is if after irrigation the sensor is dropping below 5 kpa and increasing continuously unless next irrigation is done. You can try putting water on the sensor and it should drop. Also, there should not be any fluctuations in the soil moisture data and the pressure kpa should always be increasing. Also, a soil moisture reading of 0 kPa is perfectly fine, meaning wet soil, but a reading of 200 kPa could mean fault. If the soil moisture sensor reading is consistently at 0 from few 48 hours, then it could be anamolous (use live and historical hourly soil moisture data (use tool) to validate).

Q: What is my soil moisture depletion?
A: Soil moisture depletion %age = (100 - soil moisture %age)

Q: Sensor is showing wet, i.e. less kpa but soil looks dry.
A: The sensor measures the moisture around the rootzone which is not visible from the top. Ask use to check the moisture in rootzone around the sensor. If it matches, ask the user to irrigate.

Q: I irrigated still the sensor is dropping slowly.
A: Sometimes, the water reaches slowly till root zone and the moisture sensor kPa value drops slowly. Always wait for 12 hours after irrigation for the moisture to saturate. If still some confusion, ask user to check moisture near the sensor and check if he wants to raise a ticket for the issue.

messages.content:
माती धारणा मिमीमध्ये मोजण्यासाठी खालील पद्धतींचा वापर करू शकता:

1. **मातीचा नमुना घेणे**: तुमच्या शेतातील विविध ठिकाणांहून मातीचे नमुने घ्या. 

2. **पाण्याचे प्रमाण मोजणे**: 
   - मातीच्या नमुन्यातील पाण्याचे प्रमाण मोजण्यासाठी, तुम्ही खालील पद्धती वापरू शकता:
   - **वजन पद्धत**: मातीचा नमुना वजन करा, नंतर त्याला ओलसर करून पुन्हा वजन करा. पाण्याचे प्रमाण मोजण्यासाठी, ओलसर आणि कोरड्या मातीच्या वजनात फरक काढा.

3. **माती धारणा मोजण्याची सूत्र**:
   - माती धारणा मिमीमध्ये मोजण्यासाठी, तुम्ही खालील सूत्र वापरू शकता:
   \[
   \text{Soil Moisture Retention (mm)} = \left( \frac{\text{Weight of Wet Soil} - \text{Weight of Dry Soil}}{\text{Volume of Soil}} \right) \times 1000
   \]
   - येथे, "Weight of Wet Soil" म्हणजे ओलसर मातीचे वजन, "Weight of Dry Soil" म्हणजे कोरड्या मातीचे वजन, आणि "Volume of Soil" म्हणजे मातीचा आयत (क्यूब) किंवा सिलिंडर.

4. **सेंसर्सचा वापर**: आधुनिक सेंसर्सचा वापर करून तुम्ही माती धारणा मोजू शकता. हे सेंसर्स मातीतील ओलसरता मोजतात आणि तुम्हाला पाण्याची आवश्यकता कधी आहे हे सांगतात.

या पद्धतींचा वापर करून तुम्ही तुमच्या मातीची धारणा मिमीमध्ये मोजू शकता.
messages.en:
The following methods can be used to measure soil retention in mm:

1. **Taking a soil sample**: Take soil samples from different locations in your field. 

2. **Measuring the amount of water**: 
   To measure the amount of water in a soil sample, you can use the following methods:
   - **Weight method**: Weigh the soil sample, then moisten it and weigh it again. To measure the amount of water, distinguish between the weight of moist and dry soil.

3. **Formula for measuring soil retention**:
   - To measure soil retention in mm, you can use the following formula:
   \[
   \text{Soil Moisture Retention (mm)} = \left( \frac{\text{Weight of Wet Soil} - \text{Weight of Dry Soil}}{\text{Volume of Soil}} \right) \times 1000
   \]
   Here, "Weight of Wet Soil" means the weight of moist soil, "Weight of Dry Soil" means the weight of dry soil, and "Volume of Soil" means the cube or cylinder of the soil.

4. **Use of sensors**: You can measure soil retention using modern sensors. These sensors measure soil moisture and tell you when you need water.

Using these methods, you can measure your soil retention in mm.

130 मिमी माती धारणा म्हणजे मातीमध्ये पाण्याचे साठवलेले प्रमाण खूपच चांगले आहे. याचा अर्थ असा आहे की मातीमध्ये पाण्याची क्षमता उच्च आहे, ज्यामुळे पिकांना आवश्यक पाणी पुरवले जाऊ शकते. 

### 130 मिमी धारणा असलेल्या मातीचे गुणधर्म:
1. **मातीचा प्रकार**: ही धारणा सामान्यतः लोम किंवा चिकणमातीच्या मातीमध्ये आढळते. 
2. **पाण्याची उपलब्धता**: पिकांना पाण्याची उपलब्धता चांगली असते, त्यामुळे पिकांची वाढ आणि उत्पादन क्षमता सुधारते.
3. **पिकांची निवड**: या प्रकारच्या मातीमध्ये विविध प्रकारची पिके, जसे की गहू, ज्वारी, आणि फळे यांची लागवड करणे फायदेशीर ठरते.
4. **पाण्याचे व्यवस्थापन**: पाण्याचे व्यवस्थापन अधिक प्रभावीपणे करता येते, कारण मातीमध्ये पाण्याचे साठवलेले प्रमाण अधिक असते.

सारांश, 130 मिमी माती धारणा असलेली जमीन पिकांच्या वाढीसाठी अत्यंत अनुकूल आहे.
messages.en:
130 mm soil retention means that the amount of water stored in the soil is very good. This means that the soil has a high water capacity, which can provide the necessary water to the crops. 

### Properties of soil with 130 mm retention:
1. **Soil type**: This assumption is commonly found in loam or clay soils. 
2. **Water availability**: The availability of water for crops is good, which improves the growth and productivity of the crops.
3. Choice of Crops**: It is beneficial to cultivate a variety of crops, such as wheat, sorghum, and fruits, in this type of soil.
4. **Water management**: Water management can be done more effectively, because the amount of water stored in the soil is higher.

In summary, soil with 130 mm soil holding is highly conducive for crop growth.

2. **पाण्याची उपलब्धता**: पिकांना पाण्याची उपलब्धता कमी असते, त्यामुळे पिकांची वाढ आणि उत्पादन क्षमता कमी होऊ शकते.

faq:
Q: My Kairo/Nero device is not working.
A: If some issue is being faced, user can raise the support ticket in the Fyllo app. If the issue is not solved please contact Fyllo customer support for further assistance. Do you want me to raise the support ticket for you?

messages.content:
The main differences between Kairo and Nero devices provided by Fyllo are as follows:

1. **Kairo (Weather Unit)**:
   - Primarily designed for monitoring weather conditions.
   - Measures parameters like air temperature, humidity, rainfall, and other atmospheric conditions.
   - Helps in understanding the microclimate of the farming area.

2. **Nero (Irrigation Unit)**:
   - Specifically designed for managing irrigation systems.
   - Monitors soil moisture levels, helping to determine when and how much to irrigate.
   - Aids in optimizing water usage for crops, ensuring they receive adequate moisture.

In summary, Kairo focuses on weather monitoring, while Nero is centered around irrigation management.

tools:
get_daily_soil_moisture_data  
Retrieves historical daily soil moisture data from soil moisture sensors, in kPa or percentage. Provides soilMoisture1 and soilMoisture2 fields only. Suitable for larger duration.
faq:
Q: How do I set up sensors for Kairo?
A: Place soil moisture sensors in water for about 30 minutes before starting the device.

Q: How do I determine the device position for Kairo?
A: Install soil moisture sensors in the active feeder root zone of the crop, and follow the guidelines for selecting the installation place.

Q: How many nero, kairo, and weather units i have?
A: Follow the below instructions stricly when counting anything.
1. Detailed Listing: List each device type and its associated plot explicitly.
2. Uniqueness: Check plot and device uniqueness by plotId and not by plotName.
3. Cross-Verification: Cross-check the list to ensure no plot is counted more than once.
4. Consistent Methodology: Use a consistent method for counting and verifying device types.

   Fyllo provide 3 kinds of devices:
 - Kairo / Weather Unit (Weather unit is old name of Kairo)
 - Nero / Irrigation Unit (Irrigation unit is old name of Nero)

Q: Sensor is showing wet, i.e. less kpa but soil looks dry.
A: The sensor measures the moisture around the rootzone which is not visible from the top. Ask use to check the moisture in rootzone around the sensor. If it matches, ask the user to irrigate.

Q: What should I do if the soil moisture sensor values fluctuate?
A: Ensure the sensor is installed properly in the soil, check for air bubbles, and contact Fyllo representative if the issue persists.

messages.content:
The difference in soil moisture readings between Kairo and Nero devices can be attributed to several factors:

1. **Sensor Placement**: The sensors may be installed at different depths or locations within the root zone, leading to variations in moisture readings. Kairo sensors might be positioned differently compared to Nero sensors.

2. **Soil Type**: Since both devices are used in sandy soil, moisture retention can vary. Kairo may be measuring moisture in a more rapidly draining area, while Nero could be in a zone that retains moisture better.

3. **Calibration Differences**: Each device may have different calibration settings or methods, which can affect the readings. If one device is not calibrated correctly, it may show inaccurate moisture levels.

4. **Measurement Timing**: If the readings were taken at different times, recent irrigation or rainfall could affect one device's reading more than the other.

5. **Device Sensitivity**: The sensitivity and technology used in Kairo and Nero may differ, leading to variations in how they detect and report soil moisture levels.

To ensure accurate readings, it's essential to regularly check the calibration of both devices and ensure they are installed correctly within the active root zone of the crops.

faq:
Q: What is Delta T & VPD?
A: Delta T is the difference between dry bulb and wet bulb temperature values. When this value is between 2-9, the stomatal cells on plant leaves are open, increasing the effectiveness of foliar applications.
   VPD (Vapor Pressure Deficit) represents the right time for fertigation when active absorption by a plant is highest.

messages.content: explain delta t
messages.en: explain delta t
messages.standalone_question: What does Delta T represent?
messages.standalone_en: What does Delta T represent?

faq:
Q: What is Delta T & VPD?
A: Delta T is the difference between dry bulb and wet bulb temperature values. When this value is between 2-9, the stomatal cells on plant leaves are open, increasing the effectiveness of foliar applications.
   VPD (Vapor Pressure Deficit) represents the right time for fertigation when active absorption by a plant is highest.

messages.content:
Delta T refers to the difference between the dry bulb temperature (air temperature) and the wet bulb temperature (which accounts for humidity). It is an important metric in agriculture, particularly for foliar applications and plant transpiration.

### Key Points about Delta T:

1. **Measurement**: 
   - **Dry Bulb Temperature**: The regular air temperature measured by a thermometer.
   - **Wet Bulb Temperature**: The temperature measured by a thermometer when the bulb is moistened, reflecting the cooling effect of evaporation.

2. **Importance**:
   - **Stomatal Opening**: When Delta T is between 2°C and 9°C, the stomatal cells on plant leaves tend to be open. This increases the effectiveness of foliar applications, allowing nutrients and pesticides to be absorbed more efficiently.
   - **Plant Health**: A suitable Delta T indicates optimal conditions for plant transpiration, which is crucial for nutrient uptake and overall plant health.

3. **Applications**:
   - **Fertigation Timing**: Delta T can help determine the best times for fertigation, as it indicates when plants are actively absorbing water and nutrients.

In summary, Delta T is a vital parameter for understanding plant physiological responses to environmental conditions, aiding in effective crop management practices.

   - **Wet Bulb Temperature**: The temperature measured by a thermometer when the bulb is moistened, reflecting the cooling effect of evaporation.

2. **Importance**:

   - स्थानिक भूप्रदेशामुळे पाण्याचा साठा सेन्सरच्या आजुबाजुच्या भागात असू शकतो. 

2. **200 kPa**: 
   - याचा अर्थ माती पूर्णपणे कोरडी आहे किंवा सेन्सर मातीच्या बाहेर आहे. 
   - जर 200 kPa अचानक वाढले असेल, तर कनेक्टर किंवा वायर तुटलेले असू शकते. 
   - जर हळूहळू वाढले असेल, तर तुम्ही किती काळ सिंचन केले नाही हे तपासा.

messages.en:
If there are any problems with your sensor, please check the following:

1. **0 kPa**: 
   - This indicates that the soil is very moist. This can be caused by installing new sensors or water storage. 
   If you have recently installed sensors, you need to irrigate the water at least 3 times.
   - If your crop is in a state of early or has just been pruned, your water needs may be low. 
   - Due to the local terrain, water storage may be in the vicinity of the sensor. 

2. **200 kPa**: 
   This means the soil is completely dry or the sensor is outside the soil. 
   If a sudden increase of 200 kPa, the connector or wire may be broken. 
   - If it has grown slowly, check how long you haven't been irrigated.

Do you want to make a ticket for this problem?

messages.en: When do I need water on my farm?
messages.standalone_question: When does my field need water?
messages.standalone_en: When does my field need water?

tools:
should_i_give_water  
Checks the current and optimal soil moisture values and decides whether the farmer should give water to the plot now or today.
faq:
Q: When should I water? (Hindi: Paani kab dun?)
A: 0-5 kPa is wet, and increasing kPa means increasing dryness. The crop should stay in its optimal moisture zone, and when very close or above the dry optimal moisture, water can be given. Check internal irrigation forecast for the correct answer.

Q: Why should I water my crop?
A: Watering your crop is essential to maintain the right moisture balance for healthy growth. Fyllo provides soil monitoring sensors that can provide irrigation precise requirement forecasting. The forecast will also provide the details for why and when you should irrigate.

Q: How much to irrigate after receiving notification?
A: The net quantity of water to be applied depends on the moisture deficit in the soil, leaching requirement, and expectancy of rainfall. When no rainfall is expected and the soil is not saline, the net quantity equals the moisture deficit in the soil.

Q: In the latest irrigation , sensor didn't drop to 0.
A: 0 to 5 Kpa means soil is fully wet. It need not drop to 0 every time. Moisture less than 5 also means wet conditions. So, need not worry. Also ask to wait for 12 hours after irrigation.

Q: What should I do if the soil moisture sensor always shows wet values?
A: Verify the irrigation frequency, check the installation point, and contact Fyllo representative if the issue persists.

તમારા ખેતરમાં પાણીની જરૂરિયાત નીચે મુજબ છે:

1. **Main Palot 971**: 
   - મૌસમનું પાણી આપવાની જરૂર નથી, કારણ કે જમીનનું આલમ (soil moisture) 3 kPa અને 2 kPa છે, જેની તુલનામાં આદર્શ આલમ 18 kPa છે. 

2. **Palot 812**: 
   - અહીં પાણી આપવાની જરૂર છે, કારણ કે જમીનનું આલમ 55% અને 47% છે, જે આદર્શ આલમ 50% ની તુલનામાં ઓછું છે.

તેથી, **Palot 812** માં પાણી આપવું યોગ્ય રહેશે.
messages.en:
The water requirement in your farm is as follows:

1. **Main Palot 971**: 
   - There is no need to give seasonal water, as the soil moisture of the soil is 3 kPa and 2 kPa, compared to which the ideal alam is 18 kPa. 

2. **Palot 812**: 
   - There is a need to give water here, as the alam of the land is 55% and 47%, which is less than the ideal alam 50%.

Therefore, it would be appropriate to water in **Palot 812**.

faq:
Q: Do I need to do fertigation on my farm?
A: Fyllo provides a fixed fertigation schedule based on plot and crop details, along with weather forecasting data for farmer plots, to decide the fertilizer/fertigation needs.

Q: Why should I water my crop?
A: Watering your crop is essential to maintain the right moisture balance for healthy growth. Fyllo provides soil monitoring sensors that can provide irrigation precise requirement forecasting. The forecast will also provide the details for why and when you should irrigate.

Q: When should we take the petiole and soil samples?
A: It varies crop-wise.

messages.content:
તમારા ખેતરમાં ખાતર (ફર્ટિગેશન) માટેની જરૂરિયાત નીચે મુજબ છે:

### Main Palot 971
- **વર્તમાન તબક્કો**: ફૂલ અને ફળ (Flowering and Fruiting)
- **હાલની સપ્તાહ**: 1
- **આજ**: 25 માર્ચ 2025

#### ફર્ટિગેશન શેડ્યૂલ:
1. **દિવસ 1**:
   - **ફર્ટિગેશન**:
     - **Potassium Nitrate**: 1 kg/એકર
     - **Urea**: 2.5 kg/એકર
   - **ફોસ્ફોરિક એસિડ**: 15-20 મિનિટ પહેલા લાગુ કરવું.

2. **દિવસ 4**:

     - **12-61-0**: 2 kg/એકર

     - **Calcium Nitrate**: 3 kg/એકર

### Palot 812
- **વર્તમાન તબક્કો**: ફૂલ અને ફળ (Flowering and Fruiting)
- **હાલની સપ્તાહ**: 1

1. **દિવસ 1**:

2. **દિવસ 4**:
   - **ફર્ટિગેશન**:

### આગામી તબક્કો:
- **ફળની પરિપક્વતા** (Fruit maturity) માટેની તૈયારી ચાલુ રાખો.

આ માહિતી અનુસાર, ખાતર આપવાની જરૂર છે.
